postings.body:
Looking for someone to sublet 1 bedroom in my 2 bedroom apartment for the month of August, and potentially September (I have a friend hoping to move in sometime in late September, early August). If you move in this week, I`ll still only charge for August. It`s a great spot, check it out:
About the place:
Glen park is a sweet area with awesome restaurants, grocery/convenience stores, parks, and public transportation all with easy access. Getting on 280 or 101 N/S is a breeze with almost no traffic before getting on the highway. Parking on the block is easy. The apartment is part of a three-family building and has (free) laundry machines and a private outdoor space in back. The apartment has one bathroom, a small-but-functional kitchen, and a nice comfortable living room. I keep the place very neat and deep clean every couple weeks. WiFi and utilities are on me, just need someone to cover rent. 4/20 friendly.
The Room:
Partially furnished (bed w/ new mattress, but nothing else), empty closet with lot`s of space. Great bay windows!
About me:
My name is Seth, I`m a 24 y/o male, working at an ad tech company down in San Carlos. I work during the day and frequent the climbing gym after work. I spend a lot of time outside and with my friends. I love music, exercise, art, thinking, philosophy and psychology, business, and conversing about just about anything. With a roommate, I`m down to hang out in the evenings when home, but I`m more than happy to keep to myself as well. I`ll be going away the first weekend of August and leaving to visit Peru right towards the end of the month, so you`ll have some weekends to yourself. August 9th is Outside Lands and my birthday so I`ll probably be out and about a lot that weekend as well (but no parties or anything happening here). If you`re new to the area I`m happy to help you find your way around.
Contact me:
Via email through craigslist. Questions are welcome, and if you`re interested in the place, I`d love for you to include a little about yourself - age, interests, occupation/current primary activities, reason for stay/time in SF. I`m not too picky, it`s just a month sublet, being neat/clean, independent, respectful, and responsible are my only real criteria.
Thanks!

Cincinnati, Ohio is one of the Midwest`s best-kept secrets... This family-friendly destination has tons to offer all kinds of travelers, including professional sports, river outings, parks, and museums. The city also boasts world-class art institutions, several art museums, the Cincinnati Pops, and the Aronoff Center for the Performing Arts.
This stunning ocean blue Victorian "Painted Lady" home is nestled in the city`s historic and whimsical Columbia Tusculum district, reminiscent of areas of San Francisco. With 3 bedrooms, one of which doubles as an office, 1.5 bathrooms, and enough room to comfortably accommodate 4 guests, this home is the perfect size for a couple or small family traveling together. White marble and an abundance of glorious natural light throughout the home`s interior create a bright and airy atmosphere for your vacation. You`ll immediately fall in love with the beautiful deck off the master bedroom upstairs and the 2 patios off the living spaces downstairs, all of which will let you and your companions enjoy spending time outdoors. A newly renovated kitchen makes cooking a pleasure, fully equipped with high-end appliances and everything you need to prepare your favorite meals. This residence aims to provide travelers with all of the comforts of home, including cable TV, wireless internet access, and an on-site washer and dryer.
Centrally located in the Southeastern corner of Cincinnati, this house offers easy access to area parks and is a short distance away from the city`s most notable attractions. This property is ideally situated just 4 miles from downtown in one of the top-rated communities to live in, the historic Columbia/Tusculum district. The home venues of the Cincinnati Reds and the Cincinnati Bengals are only 10 minutes from the property, and the popular King`s Island amusement park can be reached in a 30-minute drive. About a 10-minute drive away is Coney Island and Riverbend. Art institutions of the highest caliber are also in the area, such as the Cincinnati Music Hall (Home of the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra), 2 art museums, and the Arondoff Center for the Performing Arts, which hosts local theatrical and musical shows, as well as full-scale Broadway productions. The American Sign Museum is a unique attraction that showcases American signage from 1870 through 1970, which harken back to bygone eras. The home is also very close to the Children`s Hospital, 14 miles from the Cincinnati/North Kentucky airport, and across the river from the Newport Aquarium. However you choose to spend your time during your stay in Cincinnati, this elegant vacation rental house will quickly become a place you love coming home to at the end of the day!
Key Residence Features:
- Beautiful "Painted Lady," located in historic Cincinnati neighborhood
- Several parks in imediate vicinity, 10 minutes to downtown
- Great for families or couples
Bedroom Configuration:
- Master Bedroom: King-sized Bed
- Bedroom 2: Queen-sized Bed
- Bedroom 3 (Office): Twin-sized Bed
Policies:
- No smoking
- No pets allowed
- Must be at least 25 years old to book
- Additional taxes and fees may apply

Secluded location on over 6 acres, much of it wooded with nature trails. House is 2000 square feet. Big back yard with fire pit and hot tub (being repaired). Bike lanes on nearest arterial and bike trail a short distance away. There is vegetable gardening space available and also a chicken coop in need of some repair.
I am a 55 year old straight male who owns the house. We are LBGT friendly and tolerate weed, alcohol, and non-sexual nudity, and expect all who live here to have the same tolerance. Hard drugs like meth or heroin not allowed. Friends who are hard drug dealers and users are not welcome. Tobacco only allowed outside.

There is no storage space on property so all of your belongings must fit in your room. There is space in the dining room to work on light, non-messy projects (such as school work), but because this is a shared area please coordinate this activity with other residents and all of your belongings must be completely removed when you leave the room for much time. The kitchen, laundry room, and bathroom must be kept clean and be cleared out when you are done for other residents to use. There is no charge for utilities, though excessive use of laundry room is discouraged. You must provide food for yourself and your guests. Quiet time is anything that ends with AM with exceptions if arranged in advance. No pets. Residents are expected to not leave messes, clutter, track in mud, hoard dirty dishes in your room, you know, just be a good roommate.

Home to an expansive collection of World War II aircraft and other memorabilia, the Palm Springs Air Museum offers educational programs, flight demonstrations and tours.
Palm Springs Art Museum: A Leader In Community Arts Programs
The Palm Springs Art Museum offers an expansive collection of fine art, rotating exhibits, performing arts programs and educational workshops.
Moorten Botanical Garden: A Lavish Oasis in the Desert
Established in 1938, the Moorten Botanical Garden offers tours where visitors can learn about many of the animal and plant species native to the Palm Springs area.

Living Desert Zoo and Botanical Gardens: A Desert Conservation Effort

Malki Museum: A Celebration Of The Southern California Native American Cultures
Founded in 1965, the Malki Museum is home to a collection of Native American art work, pottery, baskets and tapestries.
Palm Springs Aerial Tramway Provides View From the Top
The Palm Springs Aerial Tramway offers visitors a chance to take a 10-minute ride to a mountain paradise aboard the rotating tramcar.
Knott`s Soak City Palm Springs: Stay Cool in the Desert Heat
The desert can really heat up, so head out to Knott`s Soak City Palm Springs to cool things down. Offering waterslides, a lazy river and children`s splash zone, Knott`s Soak City is sure to make for a day of fun for the whole family.

postings.body:
Greetings !
Tranquility Cottage : $ 680 weekly or $ 590 per week for two weeks or more , or negotiable as a single rental from now until September 1 st . Long term rental potential also exists for this very charming Cottage and we are currently taking rental reservations for a single livable Tree House being constructed at our site, Singing Creek.
We are an Institute for Dance on Film, and have a Cottage for rent at our premises , which is a 14 acre forested eco -sanctuary overlooking the Pacific Ocean, 40 minutes by ferry from West Vancouver , and 5 minutes by car . We are in commuting distance of Vancouver,. The Cottage is available weekly throughout the summer , or as a single rental from now until September 1 st , and may be available into the future also. The property is a sustainably managed bio -diverse forest . We are an eagle nesting area and here , the forest is a symphony of bird song all day long. Our work with forest preservation on our site can be viewed on our 4 minute you tube video , entitled " The Rare Earth Medicinal Forest at Singing Creek ". where there are many more pictures of the land and Tranquility Cottage also. The Cottage is 30 feet from a stream , has a private driveway, and has a loft bedroom , vaulted cathedral wood ceiling,full bathroom with tub/shower,kitchen/ living area with dishwasher, a deck overlooking the stream , wood burning fire place , furnishings available , including king size bed , and cozy rugs . Complimentary yoga and creative arts/ hiking group and classes in our on site yoga/ dance studio are included in rental price. Our site is called Singing Creek and there is a main lodge , dance /yoga studio , plus one other Cottage on the property. None are in view of Tranquility Cottage , which is extremely private. There is the beginnings of an out door forest gym here , and we are connected to miles of world class cycling and hiking trails.The Cottage is some what rustic . Singing Creek is a place to relax in a sun drenched hammock , sit by a campfire , stroll under 150 foot fir trees or fall asleep under the stars . We also Mentor uniquely talented individuals here in dance and film . If you are looking for a place to renew , write that next book or screenplay , or to explore cultural education, Singing Creek is created with you in mind. Our website is www.osirisinstitute.org.. .Long term Tree House accomodation is now being considered for an individual who may be particularly suited to our environment . We are planning to rent one Tree House only . We are a medicinal forest here , and involve participants in forest restoration and land reclamation with myceleum , and invite our guests at no charge to participate on the land and learn from master arborist/ horticulturists.. Inquiries are welcome at this craigslist address . Drop us a line and let us know how we can meet your needs and interests . We would be delighted to hear from you . Reservations for our upcoming Tree House vacation rentals are now also being accepted.

If you like to garden there are some great areas to start a garden. I have a shed in the backyard which has been great for storing a bike and or camping gear. The house is right near the greenway and is also approximately 4 miles from downtown.
I am 40 years old, female, lesbian, so whoever moves in must be LGBT friendly.
I have two cats, and my current roommate has one cat. We are both responsible for our cats and clean up after them and care for them. Whoever moves in has to be ok with cats. You do not have to be their best friend but please know that they are part of the household.
I am very laid back, good sense of humor, responsible, considerate, and neat. I am not OCD but like the place to be kept up. I drink socially; therefore you must be ok with that. I work full time at a hospital. 10 hour shifts four days a week from 11am-9pm. In my spare time I enjoy being outdoors as much as possible such as running, hiking, biking etc. I have an active social life and am rarely home. When I am home I clean, cook, do yard work, or just relax with a movie.
My other roommate is 34 years old, female. She works 9-5 Monday through Friday. She is laid back, good sense of humor, enjoys photography, board games, and cooking.
We are both drama free. Please be drama free as well.
I am looking for a housemate who is RESPONSIBLE, respectful, laid back; a good sense of humor would be welcomed. Someone who cleans up after themselves is a must, and chips in with some of the basic chores in the common areas would be nice too.

postings.heading: need a place to stay

postings.body:
My current roommate is wrapping up his internship and heading back to school at the end of August, so I need someone to take his spot starting Sept. 1.
The apartment is located in the heart of Koreatown and is only minutes away from other great areas in Los Angeles, like downtown, Hollywood, Silverlake, and Los Feliz. The place features hardwood floors is very big at 1,400 sq ft. It includes a large living room, a dining room, a kitchen with appliances, two bathrooms with showers and two bedrooms. You`d be renting one of the bedrooms as well as a bathroom.
The room is very spacious. It includes a small walk-in closet and it has a couple of windows with a view of our building`s beautiful little yard, which is right out front. The room is not furnished. In the hallway that leads to the room is another closet, which would be yours to use, and your bathroom. There is also a dryer and a washing machine in the building, and your rent would include parking in a garage spot that is located within our building.
Rent is $875 per month plus the cost of utilities, Internet and a maid who comes by to clean once a month. All in all, your rent + utilities would never be more than $1,000 per month. There is also no lease; it`s month to month. As I said above, the room is available Sept. 1, but you may be able to move in earlier than that.
Your roommate (aka me) is a 24-year-old dude who I hear is pretty cool. I work as a reporter, and I love to hang out in my living room watch music videos while drinking a cold one. I like to go for a run every now and then, but I really enjoy reading books, comics as well as watching movies and TV shows on Netflix. I`m also the kind of guy who likes to go out on the weekend and throw a house party every couple of months.
There`s also a good chance that I will be moving my dog into the apartment. He`s a very friendly and loyal small black labrador/cocker spaniel mix.
I`m looking for someone who I will not only get along with but also become friends with. Please only apply if:
- You`re between the ages of 21 and 28
- You`re social and like doing fun things
- You have a steady job
- You like dogs
If you`re interested and fit the criteria, shoot me an email and we can set up a time to chat/meet/tour the place, all those things. Feel free to send me any questions you may have.
